greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of factorials of the digits of n.
comment: Numbers n such that a(n) = n are known as factorions. It is known that there are exactly four of these [in base 10]: 1, 2, 145, 40585. - _Amarnath Murthy_
The sum of factorials of the digits is the same for 0, 1, 2 in any base. - _Alonso del Arte_, Oct 21 2012
reference: H. J. J. te Riele, Iteration of number-theoretic functions, Nieuw Archief v. Wiskunde, (4) 1 (1983), 345-360. See Example I.1.b.
link: Harry J. Smith and Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (first 1001 terms from Harry J. Smith)
mathematica: a[n_] := Total[IntegerDigits[n]! ]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 53}] (* Saif Hakim (saif7463(AT)gmail.com), Apr 23 2006 *)
program: (MAGMA) a061602:=func< n | n eq 0 select 1 else &+[ Factorial(d): d in Intseq(n) ] >; [ a061602(n): n in [0..60] ]; // _Klaus Brockhaus_, Nov 23 2010
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 19 2001
ext: Corrected and extended by _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 19 2001
Link and amended comment by Mark Hudson (mrmarkhudson(AT)hotmail.com), Nov 12 2004
